definition: secure in the knowledge that one has backing
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Nepoleon from think the soldier is ample, there is Shi have no perhaps.
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑自以为兵员充足，有恃无恐。

sentences.english: The untouchable ones are always stiring while the preferred ones all have nothing to fear.
sentences.chinese: 得不到的永远在驿动，被偏爱的都有恃无恐。

sentences.english: She since is the madam's person, necessarily have Shi to have no perhaps.
sentences.chinese: 她既是夫人的人，必是有恃无恐。

definition: see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
